intro: Anisomeris malaneoides, commonly known as the Malaneoides dandelion, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow disk flowers surrounded by pale green to white ray florets, typical of the genus. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Anisomeris malaneoides is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
